moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 d6 3. d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf: an unusual response to the Sicilian
moves.5... e5 6. Nb5 a6 7. Nb5c3 Be6: covering the hole at d5, something I'm somewhat obsessive about.
moves.8. Bg5 Nbd7 9. Nd5 Bxd5 10. exd5: I don't mind White occupying d5 with a pawn: much better than an unmovable piece.
moves.10... Be7 11. c4 O-O 12. Nc3 Nc5 13. O-O: ensuring that White can't exploit a bishop pair but giving up my most active piece to do so
Now we're reduced to heavy artillery and pawns.  White's pawn structure looks marginally better but the game looks pretty even to me, especially as I have a monster passed pawn at e4.
This minority attack threatens to win a pawn on c4
moves.31. Rc1 h4 32. Ree1 hxg3 33. Kxg3: Black's attack seems to be working.  White's kingside pawns are split and Black can advance his King to support his advancing pawns.
moves.35. h4+ Kh5 36. Ref1 Kg6 37. Kf4 Rfh8 38: ? this isolated passed pawn was not as important as the one on f5, supporting my pawn on e4.  My rook had it blocked.
moves.44. Kxf5 Rh5+ 45. Kxe4: The pride of my position has been thrown away
moves.45... Kd7 46. Kd3 Rh3+ 47. Re3 Rxe3+: virtually admitting defeat.  I looked at alternatives but they all looked worse.
moves.48. Kxe3 Kc7 49. Kd4 Kb6 50. a3 a5 51. a: That's enough.  I threw away an excellent position in this game.
